title: Whale Shark Encounter and Sumilon Sandbar with Kawasan Falls
description: An amazing experience. It was a very long day, 3.30am pick-up and then a 2hr+ hectic drive to Oslob. Long queues to buy whale shark tickets, but we got our tickets and then had time for our breakfast, that was basic but tasty. The WHALE shark experience was absolutely out of this world.   After a boat trip to Sumilon Sandbar (wasn't too impressed with this, way too many people on a tiny white beach), we visited the 1st of the 2 waterfalls. Tumalog was a very steep walk down a road, but so so beautiful. We took a bike back up. The hill is so steep, you can easily fall over. Last was Kawasan Falls - we were totally unprepared for this bit. It was amazing, but you need to prepare. It was about a 5kms walk along/through the river/pools and over rocks. Make sure you have good water shoes that are easy to walk in. Take your possessions (few) in a waterproof bag and take water, also money as there are a few vendors along the way. We were shattered after the walk, but it was an amazing experience. Next was the very long 2hr+ drive back. I would recommend that you actually stay for a night or 2 in the area to fully utilize all the activities in this area.

title: Amazing Manila - Tagaytay Full Day Sightseeing Tour with transfers updated 2023
description: Thanks again to the amazing staff Sean (Lead Tour Guide), Dan (Trainee Tour Guide), and Marvin (Driver) for the wonderful day. We had limited amount of time in Manila and had wanted to do a Day Trips while seeing a bit of Manila and this trip gave us all of that and more!We started the day in Manila in Intramuros (historic walled area). Good amount of history if that's what you're after and it felt like we were in Europe with the architecture.We then drove to Tagaytay. Views were fantastic. Since we were a private tour Sean suggested we take a boat ride to Taal! Sean really cared and ensured we got the most out of our day. Although I wish this was a bit more organized and the itinerary of options were more clearly outlined, but this ended up being the best part of the tour. The water was very calm, the boat ride was scenic, and the feeling of being so close to a live volcano was incredible. The experience was enriched by the stories of the locals (boat driver) and how their lives were impacted by the volcanic eruptions and how resilient people needed to be while still remaining inhabitants of the surrounding area. Also kudos to our driver Marvin for getting us everywhere on time. We had strict time deadlines and we got back exactly on time. Very much appreciated.Overall, if you want a taste of the city and nature with panoramic views then this is your trip. Would definitely book something with YOLO tours next time we're back in the Philippines everyone was very professional and booking was seamless.

title: El Nido Tour C - Hidden Beaches & Snorkeling tour(Private/Shared)
description: We will visit El Nido's best hidden beaches and islands. The Secret beach, a piece of paradise concealed by the cliffs is only accessible through a narrow crevice. You will have to swim through this opening to reach this heavenly place which is shining even under the shade created by the sun kissed cliffs. The other one, Hidden beach is surrounded by limestone rocks formations and a natural pool filled with crystal clear waters. It cannot seen from the open sea. You'll have to walk and swim for a couple of minutes to gets to it. There are black and brown seaweed which makes it's a safe havens for the endangered fish. Our next stop, Matinloc island is shaped like a heart from aerial view. Within a simple climb to leveled out limestones, you'll find a 360 degree views of the surroundings. Helicopter island and Talisay beach are a couple of awesome snorkeling areas for decent amount of marine life creatures. End of the day, we will drop you back to the El Nido floating dock.

title: Full-Day Moalboal Islands and Kawasan Falls Small-Group Tour from Cebu
description: I have no complaints about the trip, I just think that having a guide and a driver was overkill and we probably therefore paid over the odds. The guide, lovely and polite as she was, added little to the experience as she actually slept more of the long journey than we did ourselves and didn't interact that much compared to other guides we have had. The driver on the other hand was an absolute star getting us there and back safely and in not too bad a time considering the distance/conditions/traffic. Unfortunately we couldn't do one of the islands due to rough water but the Sardine run was amazing to see. Wall to wall super shoals of sardines glimmering in the water, topped off with turtles too...and a few jelly fish, nothing too painful though.I do think they should start restricting numbers better as the area is full of boats coming and going with lots of none swimmers being towed around in the water with no control of their own. It felt a little like an accident waiting to happen. Kawasan falls is lovely, if a little underwhelming due to the crowds if I'm honest.Given it's massive build up I was just expecting something else, maybe we should have done the canyoning to get the full experience. The walk along the river to the falls is beautiful, the milky water beautiful too but there are many falls in Phillipines that are as if not more spectacular.Lunch was included and was plentiful and tasty fried chicken rice veg etc.

title: Tagaytay-Pagsanjan Falls combo tour with transfers** updated 2023
description:
Tagaytay and Pagsanjan Falls are two of the most popular destinations in the Philippines, known for their stunning natural beauty and rich cultural heritage. As a tourist, you don't want to miss the chance to explore these amazing places, and a one-day tour is the perfect way to do it.

Our Tagaytay-Pagsanjan Falls one-day tour offers you the opportunity to visit two of the most beautiful destinations in the Philippines in just one day. You'll start your journey in Tagaytay, where you'll enjoy the breathtaking view of Taal Lake and Volcano, one of the country's most iconic landmarks. 

After enjoying the sights of Tagaytay, you'll head to Pagsanjan Falls, where you'll get to experience the beauty of the majestic waterfalls. You'll take a scenic boat ride along the river and then hike through the lush forest to reach the falls. Once there, you can swim in the refreshing waters, take stunning photos, and simply enjoy the beauty of the natural surroundings.

title: Private 4-kilometer Puerto Princesa Underground River Tour with lunch
description:
Want to explore deeper into the underground river? This tour will bring up to 4 kilometers deeper in the underground river. 

You will be picked up from your hotel or a common meeting point at around 7 in the morning. Your guide will bring you to the starting point in Sabang where you'll board a motor boat for 20 minutes. 

Once you're at the Park, you'll board a paddle boat that will bring you inside the cave. Instead of the usual 45 minutes, you'll be inside the cave for about 3 hours. This tour is definitely not for the faint-hearted.

After the tour, you'll head back to Sabang beach where you'll enjoy a sumptuous Filipino feast.

Optional activities are available on site, you may ask more about these from your tour guide.

title: Small-Group Weekend Hiking Tour to Banaue-Ifugao from Manila
description: My sister and I have just returned from travel to the Philippines and Taiwan and we launched our trip with this memorable journey into a beautiful rural, mountainous region north of Manila. What a gift it was to have the experience, wisdom and knowledge of our guide, Jody, and to appreciate the generous hospitality of local proprietors and residents as we traveled through, and stayed in their communities. The hiking trails and paths were in excellent condition, with steep trail ascents and descents generally consisting of stairs that offered stable footing, even following rainfall. The history of the area and the care invested in the land by inhabitants through the years is evident in the beauty of the landscapes and the manually-tended farmland. I have deep gratitude for the invitation extended to us and others by local residents, knowledgeable guides, and the travel companies that organize trips, to visit this area.

title: Honda Bay Island Hopping from Puerto Princesa City with Buffet Lunch
description: Trip taken Nov 21 2022.  The van picked us up from the Fersal hotel around 730 to drive us to Honda Bay.  Kudos to our driver for navigating through Puerto Princesa traffic.  We visited Starfish, Luli, and Cowrie islands. Lots of good swimming and snorkeling. Lunch provided at Starfish island (fish, fruits, soda. and of course rice).  Nice hammocks to rest on at Luli. Starfish island lived up to its name, saw about 10 starfish while swimming about.  The water was murky at Cowrie, so no chance to see fish of any kind.   300php charged as environmental fee upon entrance to Starfish island.  Snorkel rentals 250php.  Weather was overcast, but NO RAIN, which was a concern as it had rained heavily the previous 4 days in town.   Back at hotel around. 415p.   I recommend this trip.

title: Whale Shark Encounter & Sumilon Sandbar & Canyoneering in Kawasan Falls
description: The whole day was long, a lot packed in but so fun.  We were picked uo at 3:30 am and didnt return till 8pm, that was 7 hours of driving to and from Cebu City. Our cayoneering took over 4 hours because we were taking so many pictures.  Our canyoneering guide Albert was awesome, very patient and friendly.  Albert took so many pictures of us on our phones and they all turned out great, i highly recommend Albert.  We are not use to that much activity in one day, we are pretty sore, but it was sooo worth it.

title: Batad Guided Tour
description: Hike the rice terraces with your tour guide whose family resides right at the rice terraces. With deep connections to the residents of Batad, Banaue, you'll get indepth knowledge about the life and history of this amazing historical place. Meet some of the farmers and artisan rice wine makers, and watch how the farmers process bushels of rice into ready-to-cook rice by hand and tools inherited from their forefathers. Hike as long as you want (1-5 hours), or as short and leisurely as you want. Inhale the sweet aroma of the rice fields, as one claimed, "It smells like a freshly steamed rice."

title: Cebu City Historical Street and Food Tour
description:
Cebu is the country's oldest city and was the first Spanish settlement and the Capital of the Philippines.
Guests will witness first-hand Filipino way of life and business by walking around downtown Cebu which is often called the oldest and shortest national road in the Philippines. 

Cebu City has a deeper history compared to other islands in the Philippines since it was the first island that the Spanish colonized.
Rich in Culture and Hispanic Old Buildings. It's breathtaking how the Philippines was back then.

After the Historic Tour, Guests will have the unique chance to taste the most Authentic Cebuano Street Food!

Lastly, guests will witness the busiest produce market in the Philippines. Where all of the farmers of Cebu gather and sell their harvest. 

There's so much more to explore in the City of Cebu!
Join me and witness Filipino's everyday life and food through the Historical Street and Food Tour!

title: Tanay Nature Hiking Mountain Trekking Experience Near Manila
description:
Nagpatong Rock consists of two towering limestone cliffs facing each other. These towers seem to be made up of layers of huge blocks of rock place on top of each other hence the name Nagpatong, from Tagalog word ?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEEpatong?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEE or to put on top. But how these rock formations were formed is a secret only nature knows.

The most photographed view of Nagpatong Rock is the one with a flat top which is usually taken from the other rock formation. To accomplish this shot, your guide will assist you to the flat top before going to the other rock formation to take the shot.

Nagpatong Is really an impressive formation but not for those who have weak hearts or fear of heights. Climbing to the top of the rock is not easy as it involves climbing through bamboo ladders and vertical walls, so climb at your own risk. Risky but a worthy feat!

description:
Twin Lagoon is the key highlight of the experience. These two stunning lagoons are perfect for swimming in the most picturesque location you can imagine. You will see the spectacular scenery of green waters, fine white sand, and huge limestone cliffs while kayaking the shallow water.
Kayangan lake is???ˇa scenic mountain lake with crystal-clear freshwater. Featuring underwater rock formations, caves, and islets. It's said to be the cleanest lake in all of the Philippines.
Barracuda Lake is a tranquil cliff-enclosed lake and a unique free diving and traditional diving spot for its varying water temperature.
We will visit Balinsasayaw Reef, Twin Peaks Reef, and Reef Garden for an unforgettable snorkeling experience with plenty of marine life creatures from corals to tropical fish.
We will stop on the CYC beach and Beach 91, featuring white sand, turquoise waters, and limestone formations that make the beach a popular stop in Coron island.

title: Hop on and Discover Masungi Georeserve
description: If you're planning on visiting the Masungi Georeserve I highly recommend to hop on with the Tanlines Team! Planning the day was effortless and team members were easy to communicate with, professional, and very helpful in answering our questions. We were scheduled to go the day after Taal volcano had erupted and a Tanlines representative reached out to us immediately with conditions of the trail and addressed our concerns and needs for the day and made our overall experience even that much better. The trail itself is very light (paved path), non-technical, and relatively short (~3miles). They have alternative routes for those that don't want to climb ropes or cross swinging bridges. Our group completed the Discovery trail within 3.5 hours and can't wait to visit again! Highly recommended for anyone looking to take a quick and fun break from Manila city!

title: Pagsanjan Falls with side trip to Pililia Windmills of Rizal
description: It was so cool! Trip from Manila is kind of long, i think its 2.5hrs away, but you see a lot and if you have a good tour guide for the ride, they educate you on things and its worth the drive. The actual trip to the waterfalls was really cool but mind blowing what these guys do to get you there. You start out in calm waters in a very skinny kayak. Youll have a guide in the front and back of you. They make their way up river paddling. But when you get to the rapids, these guys are nuts! they constantly half in and out of the kayak, Literally kicking on rocks and pulling you UP the rapids. It must have been so tiring. it was such an experience to see these guys do this. the falls itself was really cool once you get there, you get on a wooden raft and they just pull you into the small cave and then bring you back. My opinion is that the ride up was the experience, not the falls at the end. The surrounding rain forest on the way up is beautiful and never gets old to look at. You sort of just glide back down. We ended up tipping the two guides quite a bit, we just couldn't believe what they just did for us. I highly suggest this as something to check out, i would do it again for sure if I ever went back.
description_clean: cool Trip Manila kind long think 25hrs away see lot good tour guide ride educate things worth drive actual trip waterfalls really cool mind blowing guys get start calm waters skinny kayak Youll guide front back make way river paddling get rapids guys nuts constantly half kayak Literally kicking rocks pulling rapids must tiring experience see guys falls really cool get get wooden raft pull small cave bring back opinion ride experience falls end surrounding rain forest way beautiful never gets old look sort glide back ended tipping two guides quite bit couldnt believe us highly suggest something check would sure ever went back

title: Mt Batolusong Dayhike From Manila
description:
Mt. Batolusong is one of the most popular hiking destinations in the Rizal province due to its proximity to Metro Manila and the fact that it offers a fantastic view of the Sierra Madre mountain range. Mt. Batolusong is located in Barangay San Andres in Tanay, Rizal. It is just two hours away from Manila.

Mt. Batolusong has three summit namely Duhatan Ridge which stands at 454 MASL, Mapatag Plateau stands at 663 MASL and Rangyas Peak stands at 883 MASL. Mt. Batolusong is a great destination for hikers looking for a quick trip to the province. Hikers can leave Manila early in the morning, walk in the grassland, breathe fresh air, and be back at home before evening.

title: indigenous Forest experience Manila 2023
description:
The Aetas people are a treasure to the community of Subic, being a truely native people of Binictican hills in Subic Bay Olongapo. The Aetas are a warm and friendly people, they are small in size and uniquely unlike most other Filipino they have tight curly hair.

The tribe?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEEs area is known as the Pamulaklakin trail and is a popular destination to visit for little money. They live in one of the few remaining untouched rainforest areas of The Philippines, here in Subic Bay Binictican.

on this tour, you will learn how the Aetas use their surroundings in there day to day life. they will also demonstrate to you some survival skills needed to survive in the jungle. they will be preparing lunch which is cooked inside the bamboo.

*** Free pick up/drop off from your hotel in Makati, Taguig, Ermita (Manila), Malate(Manila), Las Pinas, Muntinlupa, and Pasay. additional charges will incur outside these areas

title: Cebu Safari Adventure
description: Treat the family to some outdoor adventure and spend a day at the park. An hour's drive from the city and nestled atop beautiful and scenic hills is Cebu Safari, the premier Safari park in the country. The park serves as a sanctuary for hundreds of different species of plants and over a thousand animals from 120 different species. The park's main features for now are the African Savanna, Michelle's Garden, Gardens of the World and the White Lion Safari.The Park also caters to adventure seekers with its very own Adventure Park (add-on charges) which features one of the longest and highest Ziplines in the country at 1.3 kms. long and 671 m. above sea level.

title: Moalboal sardines, turtles, and Kawasan Canyon
description:
Moalboal Town is a 2 hour drive from the city center.???ˇ It is a famous dive site in the south.???ˇ Famous for beautiful nudi branches, sardines, turtles & dolphins.???ˇ A snorkel activity to it's marine sanctuary islet, Pescador island, is an amazing experience.???ˇ A seaside lunch at the restaurant after the snorkel activity. A canyoneering activity in kawasan waterfalls completes the adventure.
KAWASAN FALLS in Badian, Cebu is ranked the sixth (6th) Most Beautiful Waterfall in the world according to London-based Australian travel vlogger Amanda O'Brien.

"Kawasan Falls is surrounded by lush jungle scenery and steep limestone canyon walls. While soaking in the views, take a refreshing dip in the turquoise waters or enjoy a thrilling cliff diving experience," O'Brien said.

title: Oslob Whaleshark with Sumilon Island
description: I was in Cebu for work from late April to Mid-May. I took a one Day Trips to Oslob and Sumilon. I booked the tour with Southwind Travel and Tours. They pick up at hotel and bring you back. I was the only one on the trip so i had the guide, Rachel and the driver all to myself! They were both awesome.Cebu to Oslob is about 2.5 hours in the morning. You get there around 7am. Put on the life jacket and away you go. Six tourists to a boat. Two guides. They paddle you out to the Whaleshark feeding area, where a 'feeder' is throwing food over the sides of his canoe. The Whaleshark comes up, opens its huge mouth and inhales. You have stairs off the small boat to ease yourself into the water and you can swim right up to the Whaleshark, you cannot, or SHOULD NOT touch them. You can get pretty close as they just ignore you. It is an impressive creature! Good experience. Great for all ages. But keep in mind, "Whaleshark Tourism" is big business and there can be lots of people, I was lucky on the day i was there, it was only half packed i was told. Still when you look underwater you see scuba divers swimming around along with some pretty colorful fish. The whole experience last about 30 minutes. Water looks like its 30-40 feet deep and you are 50 yards from shore. There can be 10 or so people with you in the water at any given time. No everyone jumps in. You can take off the life jacket if you want.Then its onto Sumilon Island.Small Island, ten minute drive from Oslob. There is a small pier with a Tourist station (with bathroom) owned by the Bluewater Resort on Sumilon. Southwind Travel has an agreement with them to use the facilities. Its a 15 minutes boat ride to the Island. Great place. On the south side of the Island you have a sand bar with very gentle waves and very shallow water. Great for all ages. That is where most people hang out. I stayed practically all day on the north side where there is a marine preserve. Very nice snorkeling, lots of very colorful fish (some huge ones and some eel fish too) and sea life, including the odd 2.5 foot shark. The waves can be rough on this side. Lots of bolders, rocks. The tour included lunch at the Resort. It was a very good buffet I might add. The snorkeling beach has little tiki huts with elevated floors (no sand on your towels!!!!) and hammocks. You spend four hours or so there. Its not too busy, so you can just relax.Around 1:30 pm we headed home. Took the boat to shore. The ride home was close to 4 hours.All in all, a very great Day Trips and I could see myself staying a couple of days at the Bluewater Resort as it looked very nice.
description_clean: Cebu work late April MidMay took one Day Trips Oslob Sumilon booked tour Southwind Travel Tours pick hotel bring back one trip guide Rachel driver awesomeCebu Oslob 25 hours morning get around 7am Put life jacket away go Six tourists boat Two guides paddle Whaleshark feeding area feeder throwing food sides canoe Whaleshark comes opens huge mouth inhales stairs small boat ease water swim right Whaleshark touch get pretty close ignore impressive creature Good experience Great ages keep mind Whaleshark Tourism big business lots people lucky day half packed told Still look underwater see scuba divers swimming around along pretty colorful fish whole experience last 30 minutes Water looks like 3040 feet deep 50 yards shore 10 people water given time everyone jumps take life jacket wantThen onto Sumilon IslandSmall Island ten minute drive Oslob small pier Tourist station bathroom owned Bluewater Resort Sumilon Southwind Travel agreement use facilities 15 minutes boat ride Island Great place south side Island sand bar gentle waves shallow water Great ages people hang stayed practically day north side marine preserve nice snorkeling lots colorful fish huge ones eel fish sea life including odd 25 foot shark waves rough side Lots bolders rocks tour included lunch Resort good buffet might add snorkeling beach little tiki huts elevated floors sand towels hammocks spend four hours busy relaxAround 130 pm headed home Took boat shore ride home close 4 hoursAll great Day Trips could see staying couple days Bluewater Resort looked nice

description: Wow! That?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEEs all I can say about this tour. The view on the entrance to the Underground cave was so beautiful. Inside the cave was amazingly mesmerizing! There were a lot of bats that smells a little, but not too much, unless you have a really sensitive nose. The rock formation inside the cave was interesting. The tour guide who will take you in the cave pointing out some interesting shape. It was fun to see the rock formation as the guide sees it. It was very dark in the cave but don?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEEt worry, the guide has flashlight. After the Underwater, you get to eat lunch for free, included on your tour.. after lunch, you will drive to Ugong arocks where you can explore another cave by foot, and Zipline on top of the cave. This is optional, and cost money to do it, but very affordable.

description: Cebu Safari & Adventure Park is one of Cebu's most new and exciting attractions in Cebu, a zoological garden located at the mountains of Barangay Corte, Carmen, 50 kilometers north of Cebu City. One of the most exciting areas of the park is the African Savanna, a large enclosure that visitors tour on a safari truck. The African Savanna Tour showcases animals. title: Private Bohol Firefly Watching Cruise
Jellyfish sanctuary and Sohoton cove Full-Day Tour
description:
In order to grab the best possible experience, we will pick you early in the morning from where you're staying in General Luna, Siargao island. From General Luna jetty, you will get the excursion boat. Our key spotlight, Sohoton cove is a cluster of small islets with lagoons, limestone caves and rock formations. The natural beauty of this area is absolutely stunning and breathtaking.

Jellyfish Sanctuary is one of few and unique locations where you may swim and do snorkeling with harmless jellyfish. Swimming with them in the blue lagoon will be a memorable experience.

We will explore???ˇHagukan and Crystal Caves, only accessible by water and our experienced guides will escorted you to explore the caves. A short distance swimming under the water is required. But our experienced guides will be able to bring non swimmers to the breathable space inside the coves.

End of the day, we will drop you back to the hotel safely.

title: Puerto Princesa Fireflies Watching with Dinner
description: The jump off point for the boats and the dinner were nicely landscaped and decorated.  The buffet dinner was only adequate with only a single soup selection and 4 or 5 other dishes for the buffet.  During the dinner, a presentation was given on the fireflies and what else you might see.  Aside from a pleasant paddle boat in the dark, it was really disappointing not to see much in terms of fireflies.  On the boat ride out and back we saw maybe about 15 trees that had fireflies.  It was not as advertised where there would be thousands of fireflies around you.  While they also talked about  bioluminescent plankton, we never saw any.  Not worth the money unless you wanted to see the stars at night in a boat!  The first picture is what we saw and the second picture is what they advertised what we would see.

description: A unique Island Hopping Tour to Virgin Island and Hilantagaan including lunch and sea food tasting (if available) during the tour. Enjoy the taste of the Central Visayas! title: Coron Shipwrecks and Lusong Coral Garden tour (Private / Shared)
description:
During this experience, you'll witness the famous World War II wreck that sits at the shallow ocean floor. Other than that we will visit Lusong Coral Garden to getup close with an array of dazzling marine life, excellent corals, vibrant colorful fishes and occasional sea turtles.

We will visit the Lusong Gunboat : a famous snorkeling and diving site, a shallow area with a shipwreck that lays on an angle on its side. The gunboat is approximately 25m in length, and its stern can be visible at low tide.

The East Tangat, sunk on the 24th of September 1944 during the World War II that was believed to be either a tugboat or an anti-submarine craft. This area has a good visibility and a very good shallow water, which makes it an ideal choice for snorkelers.
Lusong Coral garden is a popular Coron Snorkeling experience featuring many varieties of corals. You will enjoy a good visibility there.

We will visit the Pass island for a amazing snorkeling and island hopping experience.

title: Camiguin Island Tour 3Days and 2nights
description:
Nested in the northern Mindanao, Philippines, is a pear-shaped volcanic island of Camiguin, aptly called as the ?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEEIsland Born of Fire?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEE. It is roughly 100 kilometers north of Cagayan de Oro City in Misamis Oriental.

It can be considered as the Hawaii of the South East Asia as this island was created by volcanic eruptions and land movements. It has a total of seven volcanoes, one of which is the active Mount Hibok-Hibok that last erupted in 1953. Having been blessed by natural wonders and historical treasures, the island is truly a paradise. Among the most famous landmarks of Camiguin is an uninhabited white island that is around two kilometers off the shore of Agoho. It is actually a sandbar that offers a picturesque view of Mt. Hibok-Hibok. This sandbar submerges substantially during high tides.

title: Subic Bay Jungle Survival Basic Skills
description:
The Aeta's of Subic Bay have long lived within its forests withstanding waves of colonization and have survived independently. However, modernization is slowly forcing the natives to look for menial jobs elsewhere and their culture and know how is at risk of going extinct.

Spending time in their forest helps them keep staying and taking care of the place they live in and also leaves the visitor with jungle survival skills.

You will learn how to start a fire without matches, use a blow gun and native bow and arrow; cook using only bamboo and make bamboo utensils.

title: Day-Trekking and Fun Activities in Masungi in Baras, Philippines
description: Want to enjoy a day full of adventures and discovery? The Masungi Georeserve is the perfect place for your ecotourism desires. It is a conservation area located in Rizal, in the northeast of Manila, the capital city. It covers around 1,600-hectare of protection of the Philippines impressive flora and fauna, which can boast of more than 350 species. It has been a popular spot for tourists or local visitors who are into hiking, climbing or simply, admiring nature. They have been taking multiple Day Tripss from Manila since it opened in 2015 and started expanding into becoming a Geopark. So, if you are looking to escape from your monotonous daily city life, join us and you will be guided through caves, stone trails, rope courses, and a hanging bridge while finding out more about the efforts of conservation for this unique spot in the last two decades.

title: Private Vehicle to Oslob Cebu Whale Shark Experience
Bohol Countryside Day Tour From Cebu City | Lunch at Loboc River Cruise
description:
Explore the rustic beauty of Bohol's countryside on this unique tour. Discover the world-famous Chocolate Hills, an enchanting geological formation made up of over 1,000 limestone mounds that resemble giant chocolate kisses. Take in the serene beauty of the Loboc River as you enjoy a scenic river cruise and indulge in a delicious lunch of local cuisine.

Visit the Tarsier Conservation Area, home to the world's smallest primates, the cute and elusive Tarsiers, where you can see these fascinating creatures up close in their natural habitat. Take a stroll through the quaint and historic Baclayon Church, one of the oldest churches in the Philippines and a testament to the country's rich colonial history.

This Bohol Countryside Tour is a unique and immersive experience that offers a glimpse into the authentic beauty and culture of this beautiful island. It's a must-see for travelers seeking an off-the-beaten-path adventure that combines natural wonders, cultural heritage, and local charm.

title: Bucari Leon (Little Baguio) Tour
description: Bucari is an area with mountainous terrain situated in the highlands of Leon and Alimodian, both are municipalities of Iloilo province in Panay island, Philippines. It is composed of Bucari, a barangay in Leon and neighbouring barangays of which 14 barangays are in Leon and 7 barangays are in Alimodian which is called the "Seven Cities". It is known as the "Summer Capital of Iloilo" and declared as a special economic zone for tourism and ecological enterprise due to its cool climate, topography, highland attractions and scenery.

title: Cebu Whalesharks, Sumilon Whitesand & Kawasan Waterfalls
description:
We pick up all travellers from their hotel within the city. We travel down to south of Cebu before sunrise. A sea valley round south Travel experience. A 30 minute snorkelling activity with many whalesharks. A breakfast at the nearby restaurant. A beach bumming, snorkelling, relaxing at the powdery whitesand of Sumilon. An hour transfer to the famous Kawasan Waterfalls. Trekking & swimming at the waterfalls is the most refreshing activity of all. 
KAWASAN FALLS in Badian, Cebu is ranked the sixth (6th) Most Beautiful Waterfall in the world according to London-based Australian travel vlogger Amanda O'Brien.

"Kawasan Falls is surrounded by lush jungle scenery and steep limestone canyon walls. While soaking in the views, take a refreshing dip in the turquoise waters or enjoy a thrilling cliff diving experience," O'Brien said.

title: Whale Shark Encounter and Sumilon Sandbar with Tumalog Falls
description:
Explore the natural wonders of Cebu with our Oslob Whale Shark, Sumilon Island, and Tumalog Falls Tour Package! Swim with the gentle giants of the sea - the whale sharks - in Oslob, visit the stunning Sumilon Island, and experience the beauty of Tumalog Falls.

First, swim alongside the majestic whale sharks in their natural habitat and witness their grace and beauty up close. After your whale shark encounter, we will take you to the beautiful Sumilon Island. Enjoy the pristine white sand beach and crystal-clear waters, go snorkeling or simply relax under the sun.

Next, visit the breathtaking Tumalog Falls, known for its stunning cascades and crystal-clear waters. Take a refreshing dip in the cool waters or simply enjoy the beautiful scenery.

This tour package includes round-trip transportation from your hotel, entrance fees, snorkeling gear rental, and a professional tour guide who will ensure that you have a safe and enjoyable experience.

title: Pagsanjan Falls Tour From Manila
description:
Pagsanjan
The most popular way of reaching the falls is through the Shooting the rapids boat ride, which originates from any of the resorts along Bumbungan and Balanac Rivers. Two skilled and licensed boatmen takes one to three passengers on wooden or fiberglass, long, narrow canoes to the falls, which could take more than an hour of paddling upstream depending on traffic and water level. The journey takes passengers through the narrow and verdant Pagsanjan Gorge lined with huge boulders, rocks and small waterfalls. The ride upstream ends in a natural pool below the falls where an optional raft ride takes visitors through a curtain of cascading water to the Devil's cave behind the falls. The return trip called Shooting the rapids is a thrill ride through fourteen rapids as the skilled boatmen maneuvers the boat through the narrow rocks as it head downstream

title: Mt Pulag Private Tour Night travel from Manila ( Max 6 Travelers Only)
description: Known as the "playground of the gods", Mt. Pulag reaches 2,922 meters above sea level. Being the highest point in Luzon, the trek offers adventurers a breathtaking experience. Both in the climb and the view, you will feel what it is like to be above the clouds. At near-freezing temperatures, the path winds through pine trees and grasslands. Finally at the summit, take in your reward - a most magnificent sunrise.

title: Private Full-Day Tagaytay Tour from Manila
Dumaguete Lake Balanan
description: Located in Sitio Balanan, Siaton- about an hour and half drive from Dumaguete, Lake Balanan is 285 meters above sea level and is fed by the Lamarao, Balanan and Managobsob creeks. For those who love nature-trekking, there is a four-kilometer circumferential pathway around the Lake under a canopy of vaious indigenous forest trees. Trekkers will also get a chance to see three waterfalls at the other side of the Lake.

title: Oslob Whale Shark and Kawasan Falls Canyoneering Day Tour
South Countryside Tour
description:
Pick-up from your accommodations and proceed to the southern part of Cebu. Upon arrival in 

Carcar (known as the Heritage City of Cebu), meet your local guide for an introduction to the city. Hop on a wooden cart being pulled by a carabao, feel the burning sensation of the coconut wine down your throat, unleash your creativity as you weave your own basket and take a tricycle to bring you back to the waiting vehicle parked at a distance. Proceed to St. Catherine of Alexandria Church with its architecture Spanish colonial structures and a drive thru the popular stone houses. Grumbling stomach? Not a problem as Carcar is bursting with flavors: ampao (sugared puff grains), bucarillo (caramelized coconut strips), chicharron (pork rind crackling) and the lechon (roasted pig). Lunch will be served at a local restaurant. Then back to the hotel.

title: Mt Pinatubo Day Trips PRIVATE TOUR MAX 6 Travelers
description:
Go on an off-road 4x4 adventure to Mt. Pinatubo, the volcano with the second largest eruption of the 20th century. The adventure starts on a sturdy 4x4, passing through the rough terrain of Crow Valley Canyon. Next is a trek over rivers and through lahar formations as you arrive to the beautiful Pinatubo Lake. Relax with the walls of the caldera around you, gazing out at the ever-changing waters of the volcanic lake.

Only Fully Vaccinated Travelers are allowed to join this tour

title: Private Whale Shark, Island hopping and Waterfall with Transport
description:
We offer an incredible day-long adventure through the stunning Cebu Island, starting bright and early at 3 am, where we will take you on a scenic drive across Cebu to Oslob. Here, we set off on a rowboat to get up close and personal with these majestic creatures. You will even have the opportunity to swim alongside them!

Next, we'll take you on a fantastic island hopping adventure to Sumilon Island, where you can indulge in some snorkeling and bask in the sun on the beautiful white sand beach. After returning from the island, we'll stop for a delicious lunch before heading to Tumalog Falls, where you can immerse yourself in the refreshing, cool waters of the mountain springs.

We will return you to your hotel or Airbnb by around 7 pm, ensuring that you have had an unforgettable experience on Cebu Island. Our goal is to provide you with a perfect mix of adventure and relaxation, creating memories that will last a lifetime.

title: Puerto Princesa Underground River Tour in Palawan
description:
Puerto Princesa Subterranean River National Park, also known as Puerto Princesa Underground River, is located around 76 km northwest of Puerto Princesa in the Saint Paul Mountain Range. Named as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, it houses a ?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEEmountain to sea?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEE ecosystem with some of the most significant and intact old-growth forests in Asia, featuring the spectacular limestone karst landscape and the globally significant habitat for biodiversity conservation and threatened species of wildlife.

There are eight intact forest formations found in Puerto Princesa Subterranean River National Park: the beach forest, forest on ultramafic soil, forest on limestone soil, freshwater swamp forest, lowland evergreen tropical rainforest, mangrove forest, montane forest, and riverine forest. The Palawan Moist Forest, recognized by the WWF's Global Report, is outstanding biodiversity containing the richest tree flora with high levels of regional and local endemism.

title: Experience Gems in Sibalom National Park (Nature Tour)
description:
Sibalom Natural Park is a 5,511.47-hectare (13,619.1-acre) protected area in the Philippines on the island of Panay

The park has a mild montane forest, a lowland forest, some bushland and open cogon or grassland.[2] Its riverbeds contain semi-precious gemstones such as agate, jasper and onyx.[5]
About 5,000 hectares of forest in Sibalom from Mount Porras extending to Mount Igmatindog, covers Sibalom River and its tributaries. Of this forest, 672 hectares are undisturbed by any human activity while about 4,223 hectares constitutes the 50-year-old reforestation site

One of the main highlights is the large flower Rafflesia speciosa, discovered in Mount Porras and surrounding barangays in 2002[6]
The Philippine dipterocarp trees such as white lauan and apitong, and fruit trees such as antipolo and malapaho are found in the forests of Sibalom. The globally endangered giant flower, the Rafflesia speciosa, also blooms in the park.

title: Oslob Whale Shark Watching
description: I want to say that any form of animal incarceration is unnatural but for many this is the only opportunity to witness these beautiful creatures close to their normal habitat.If you feel this is something you wish to do then at least let me offer some details of what is involved.The site is in Natalio Bacalso Avenue, Oslob. The site opens at 06:00 - 12:00 each day. I had heard different options for going but on this date 03/02/2023 this is how it went.Arrived at site at 08:00 and was told there was only one Whale Shark and it was unlikely that we could go out. I explained I only had this day and was prepared to wait. So I put my name in the book and I was no. 150. I got to pay for the experience at 10:00 and was on the boat at 10:20. Well worth the wait. There is a sheltered area or sit in the sun.If I had of arrived at 06:00 I would have been back on shore having seen the Whale Sharks at 07:00.It was a wonderful experience. We rented a camera (550 pesos) which we gave to one of the guys on the boat and he did the photography and videoing (100 pesos tip). You can use your camera in a water proof bag if you have one (or can buy onsite).You get into a boat with approximately 10 others, they row you out and using the boats create a constant barrier inside which they feed the sharks to keep them in the zone for us tourists to see up close.If you have an issue with captivity then this is not for you, but for the majority of normal people we can see the real creatures and hope the money spent is well invested to protect and save the WS?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEEs.The experience lasted approximately 30 minutes and was a pleasure. Life jackets and masks were included for a fee of 500 pesos, snorkels and flippers could be hired.There were restaurants, souvineer shops and  equipment shops (where I bought water shoes for 400 pesos) at the site.As we are at 11:30 the site was closing. I have attached some photos to hopefully give a feel for the site.

title: Taal Volcano Eruption Sightseeing and Pagsanjan Falls (2-in-1 Tour from Manila)
description: Overall I had only 2,5 days in Manila, but I did not want to spend them just by sitting at the hotel swimming pool or viewing concrete jungle. So, I decided to go for this trip - outside the city, closer to nature and, of course, safer if this trip is done by a local. And it was the correct choice! We had our fantastic guide Allan, who took care of us whole journey long. He safely drove us to volcano Taal: first of all to take a look from far, and then closer from the lake side. Our small group chose to go for a 2h boat trip to volcano Taal (and again it was absolutely correct choice, as the volcanic island showed completely different looks from each perspective). I particularly liked a lot to see the local fishermen daily routines, when they take care about their fishing areas, fishing nets etc. The second big journey was to Pagsanjan Waterfalls, and it was even more amazing experience. Jurassic park views, feeling like in the middle of jungle, beauty of nature and the power of river was there! On top of that we were brought by boat and two professional local rowers against the river flow and over the rapids to the waterfalls (it seemed like these two men know each stone under the water by heart). Woooow. Nature is amazing, and so is the main Pagsanjan waterfall. What a wonderful process and experience! So, I definitely recommend this 2-in-1 tour to others, who like nature more than concrete city jungle views.

title: Half-Day Manila City Tour
description: We took the half day Manila city tour, which was 1pm to about 6:30 pm (Blue Horizons Travel and Tours).  Our first time to Manila so the tour gave us some highlights in a short time without the hassles of doing it alone.Highly recommended, we were picked up at our Makati hotel in an aircon van.  The tour guide Jonas provided fantastic historical background and local knowledge for all the stops, while the dedicated driver JR handled that wild Manila traffic.The stops were as described in the tour, we did a slightly different order, for example first stop was American Cemetery and Memorial in BGC, a beautiful spot honoring American and Philippine war dead.  We were struck by how immaculate the memorial and gardens were and the scale of the names listed for the many thousands who lost their lives.We hit all the spots in Manila - Intramuros, Casa Manila, San Agustin Church.  We breezed past any lineups as we were with our guide Jonas.  Jonas' english was excellent and was keen on providing a real tour guide experience.  We gained knowledge of Philippine history and heroes such as Jose Rizal, as well as the local view of history, politics, and daily life for Filipinos.  I'm sure the tour had been given many times but the presentation was fresh and enthusiastic.  Thanks again for the tour!  Trev+Vicky

title: Mactan Cebu Island Hopping with Lunch - Gilutungan, Caohagan, Nalusuan
description: The only reason I am giving 4 stars is because I'm sure there are more premium snorkeling experiences out there (depending on how much experience you have going on snorkeling tours) so if you're one of those people, I wanted to give the proper relative rating...but for anything that was lacking or not up to your standards, Obet and the deckhands (Warren and Julius I believe were their names) made up for it and then some with their level of attentiveness and service.  Here's an example of how attentive the deckhands were...one of them noticed on several occasions that I was either having issues with my mask or that I was lagging behind the others or that I was ready to get back to the boat.  Each time, they were right beside me to even help fix my gear or shuttle me through the water (he had fins).  That made a huge impression on me and is worth gold when it comes to an experience.We can't speak highly enough about Obet.  On our trip home, we asked about some local favorite foods and he even stopped at a couple unique bibinka and turon stands for us to grab some treats on the way home.This was one of our highlight trips during our visit to Cebu and I highly recommend this business for their service and attentiveness alone!

title: Bohol Countryside Day Tour from Cebu City or Mactan - Best Seller
description: In what was nothing short of an adventure, Thank you to Cebu tours and, most importantly, our tour guide, Allan, for a fantastic day in Bohol.Bohol is such a beautiful island, and we are so happy that we got to experience it as we almost canceled the tour entirely due to a schedule change. Allan was waiting for us at the pier and took us to grab breakfast before embarking on our adventure. He shared with us so much about Filipino culture and his life in Bohol. We saw the chocolate hills, Tarsier sanctuary, Ziplined, and Lunch on the river. Due to the holidays, we got to see local groups perform and sing Christmas songs and cultural dances (if they offer for you to participate, do it!)Unfortunately, my wife and I were in the Philippines during Typhoon Ursula and were stuck in Bohol, along with many other tourists and locals. We had left our luggage and IDs in Cebu as it was only supposed to be a Day Trips but were in Bohol for two days before getting to leave. Despite learning this information, Allan went out of his way to speak to the boat company and get us new tickets for the next day (despite trips being canceled until Christmas day). Allan continued to maintain communication with us and made sure we made it back to Cebu safely.Overall, I can't stress how much we loved this tour and the opportunity to visit Bohol, if we return to the Philippines we plan on making a trip directly to Bohol! Thank you Cebu Tours!

title: Wild n Wowed Cebu Tour: Whale Shark Snorkeling, Kawasan Canyoneering and Zipline
description:
Experience an unforgettable & full-fledged tour of the best tourist spots - Oslob Whale Sharks & Kawasan Falls Canyoneering with an array of activities fit for thrill seekers & nature lovers!

title: Cavinti Laguna Cave Complex w/ transfers from manila 2023
description:
The Cavinti Cave Complex is a natural wonder that will take your breath away. With its magnificent rock formations, crystal-clear pools, and winding passages, the cave complex offers a unique and unforgettable adventure for nature lovers and thrill-seekers. As you explore the depths of the cave, you'll be amazed by the beauty and diversity of the formations that have been shaped by water and time. 

this cave is not just a place for adventure , it's also a site of cultural and historical significance. The cave complex was once a refuge for Filipino revolutionaries during the Spanish colonial period, and the caves themselves have been used for religious and cultural ceremonies for centuries. By visiting the Cavinti Cave Complex, you'll not only be experiencing the beauty of nature but also immersing yourself in the rich history and culture of the Philippines.

title: Banaue & Batad UNESCO 3days 2 nights Tour ( Private Group Tour Max 6 Travelers)
description:
The Banaue Rice Terraces are 2000-year old terraces that were carved into the mountains of the Cordilleras by the Ifugaos. The Rice Terraces are commonly referred to as the "Eighth Wonder of the World?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEE, and a Unesco World Heritage Site. The terraces, built by hand are located approximately 1500 meters (5000 ft) above sea level and cover 10,360 square kilometers (about 4000 square miles) of mountainside. Our Private Tour is limited to a maximum 6 persons Only with a Private Transportation from Manila.

Our Company started bringing travellers up north for more 15 years and counting and we specialised this route. our advocacy is to support the community by engaging our clients with the local people in the mountain region, by this your visit will be more enjoyable and memorable.

title: Half-day Puerto Princesa City Tour
description: Canvas Hotel is a lovely place to stay in for a couple of nights of so in Puerto Princesa. It is artfully designed and well-maintained. Just don't eat at their restaurant or order room service because the food is costly (for a provincial place) and very bad. Instead, eat the Tito's just right across he hotel. For South Sea Peals and pasalubong, there are rows of stores and legitimate jewelry stores also just across the hotel. Kinabuch's and Kalui are also very good restaurant choices. Puerto Princess is rather small so almost all restaurants and even the Bay Walk is walkable, but the warm weather could be a problem. Taxi has to be called and arranged and costs P250 each time. Tricycle is the main city transport but costs P50/head for very short distance and P100/head at night or when they say the location is "far." The Underground River tour is a must. You can skip the firefly watching.

title: Oslob Whale Shark Swimming and Kawasan Falls Canyoneering
description: Booked a private Oslob whale shark + canyoneering experience for $120/head. I was expecting to ride a van with lots of other people but I was surprised to be picked up with a private driver, Jerlan. Car was clean and comfortable, had a good sleep with the neck pillow I brought, it took 3.5 hrs from Cebu to Oslob. Driver was very accommodating and told us to tell him anytime we want to stopover for bathroom break or buy snacks. We get to Oslob area and rented a Go Pro hero 7 for $11 (it was worth it!)The whale shark experience was surreal and pictures/videos dont do it justice. Sad it was only 30mins but was grateful for the experience! The breakfast place (not included in package) which was Sunrise 888 served breakfast meals for around $3-4/meal. It wasnt worth it for me as portions were too small for the price they chargedNext, we drove 1.5hrs to get to the canyoneering area and met with our tour guide Tam2x. We hiked for 30mins to get to the falls and he took lots of amazing pictures/videos of us. Hes such an amazing tour guide. We had a great meal at MC Rich center after consisting of rice, fried chicken, pork soup. Wish it was a little warmer but food was good!I tipped both of them $10 each because these are nice people and not money hungry like how most Western tipped workers are. Jerlan and Tam2x were just happy to do their jobs and be as welcoming as possibleWish it was cheaper but im very happy with all the people!

This tour takes you on a 1.5-hour jungle hike to a tribal village home to the Batak people, indigenous people of the Philippines. You can see the culture and way of life of tribal people that are now diminishing in the mountains in palawan.

 This is part of the Sustainable Tourism Project to help preserve the culture and living traditions of the Batak indigenous cultural communities and to create opportunities for livelihood from tourism activity, the Batak Visitor Center and Cultural Village was established and Kultura Batak Tourism Producers Cooperative are those poeple produces and sells handicraft as souvenir items to tourists.

The tours starts from pick up from your city center hotels. IF your hotel is located outside the city center an extra pick up and drop off charge for the van will be collected.

title: Coron Island Tour B (Private)
description:
Spend a day soaking up the sun and enjoying the beach life with this tour of some of Coron's best spots for island fun! You'll begin your tour with a visit to Barracuda Lake, a gorgeous lake surrounded by sturdy trees and a popular spot for many divers because of its dramatic temperature shifts. Strong shoes are recommended for this tour as the path to the lake itself can be difficult, but you'll be rewarded with a fun dip in the lake's crystal clear waters. This is followed by a stop at Skeleton Wreck, a sunken warship, where you can enjoy swimming with colorful fishes and maybe even touch the edge of the ship if the tide gets low enough!

title: Bohol Firefly Watching (Private)
description:
Do something different other than the typical things to do in Bohol by going on an evening boating trip in the Abatan River, a perfect opportunity to see a number of fireflies. This stream journey added with a local nearby supper in the waterfront town of Baclayon, is ideal for nature sweethearts and urban-inhabitants seeking tranquility in the island area. As you journey through the serene and still waters and oar more profound into the mangrove, the sound of
crickets will pervade the century-old swamp, which shows a healthy ecosystem. En route, you will be seeing the riverside communities that benefit from the waterways, and in return, protect the area that sustains their livelihood along with the endangered flora and fauna that live in it. The hour-long ride will remunerate you with mysterious sights, unpolluted air, and cool breezes brushing against your face.

title: Discover Scuba diving in El Nido
description:
Discover scuba diving (DSD) is a quick and easy way to explore the underwater world as a complete beginner.

The whole experience will be conducted by certified professionals in a safe and secure environment.

DSD is an experience is for everyone (the participant must be physically fit reasonably) which means no any previous experience or certification is required!

A day before the excursion, you will meet the crew for the orientation and paperwork (at 5 PM).

In the next day morning, we will begin the real adventure. First, you will learn the confined water skills under the supervision and instructions of the professionals and then we will ride our boat for the adventure with the confidence.

During the diving sessions, you can expect a focused and undivided attention of our staff with a maximum of four certified divers per divemaster or two students per instructor because your safety and comfort are the most important things to us.

During the experience lunch will be also provided.

title: Kawasan Canyoneering Adventure Package from Cebu
description: We were picked up from our hostel at 5:00am which was incredibly early but worth it! When we arrived there weren't many people so we got to experience the falls alone and at our own pace. What we really enjoyed was that everything was optional. If you did not want to jump into the water from 13 meters, there was always a path that you could walk instead. This is a great adventure for people at any age and any fitness level. Our guide Mark was funny, knowledgeable and helpful. He let us know where every rock was under the water so we did not get hurt. He also stopped us at different points to take our photo for us and filmed us jumping into the water. Lunch was also delicious and made with love and care. There are many rival companies that do the "same" package, but this company is worth every penny you spend!

Skip the Line: Villa Escudero Plantation & Resort Day Pass Ticket
description: I have been here three (3) times already, and the most recent one was before the pandemic. I indicated that I went to the place in January 2022, just to comply with the requirements of the review. Nevertheless, I can still feel the excitement and anticipation of being inside the resort whenever I am preparing for a trip to Villa Escudero. First, the various WWII mementos on the ground near the place where the carabao cart pickup is always a delight for visitors. Second, the religious items collected by the owners of the place is a flashback of our religious history and a testament to our endearing faith to the Roman Catholic Church. Third, the luncheon by the waterfalls is unique and can only be done inside the resort. Moreover, the food itself is an added value to the trip. Visiting the place with the whole family is recommended, it will give the family members to bond while appreciating the life of our ancestors.

title: Private Filipino cooking class in a local Manila Home
description: I had a truely great time at Isi's! We went through a bunch of recipes from scratch, using awesome ingredients and discussed in detail anything from origin, food handling and preparation. She hooked me up with some very solid basics of filipino cooking as well; I'll definitely keep on cooking the dishes I learned today! I was familiar with filipino cooking before, but Isi really knows how to bring it to the next level by adding just that extra touch or condiment - it was inspiring how confident she was in the kitchen. title: Whale Shark Watching & Tumalog Falls & Kawasan Falls
description: This is not a review as such, bit more in the nature of an advice.  Most people (and websites, guides and write-ups) will tell you to reach the Whale Shark Center in Oslob early so as to avoid the crowds.  To my mind, that's a mug's game.   When we reached at about 8 AM there was a lot of crowd - in fact the crowd starts to gather there as early as 6 AM.  But by 10 AM all the crowd had vanished.  There was only a trickle of people, even though it was a weekend.  Accordingly, I would advise that you reach there at 10 AM - the big fish would still be there, but the crowds would have gone home by then.  They don't allow you in the boat for more than about 30 minutes, and the Centre closes at 11 AM........so you will be fine.
description_clean: review bit nature advice people websites guides writeups tell reach Whale Shark Center Oslob early avoid crowds mind thats mugs game reached 8 lot crowd fact crowd starts gather early 6 10 crowd vanished trickle people even though weekend Accordingly would advise reach 10 big fish would still crowds would gone home dont allow boat 30 minutes Centre closes 11 AMso fine

title: Oslob Whaleshark and Kawasan Falls Tour
description: I had one free day in Cebu before work the remainder of the week. I came across this recommended tour and knew I had to go for it, despite intense jet lag and a 3:00 am pickup time!  A 3-hour drive to Oslob whale sharks allowed for some catchup on sleep before an amazing experience swimming with the whale sharks for 20 free minutes! It was a great experience, with GoPro rental to allow for underwater photos swimming with the majestic creatures!But the highlight was to come after, with 10km hike/swim/jump Canyoneering adventure, which included some high cliff jumps of 10m and 15m!  This was a great adventure, beginning with the longest zipline in Asia and continuing with a great mix of hiking, swimming, and rock jumping! I got lucky to be the only participant, along with my guide, Leizel. As a result I paid for two people (no solo Day Trips), but it was worth it! And Leizel was so much fun - her enthusiasm for the canyoneering made it even more of a joy!  Definitely do it!

title: Cebu City and Mactan Tour - Private
description: Touring around Cebu City and Mactan made easy and inexpensive. Enjoy the city's historic, religious and cultural site and savor a delightful lunch buffet. In Cebu City, visit famous like the Philippine Taoist Temple, Heritage of Cebu Monument, Magellan's Cross, Basilica Minore del Santo Nino, and Heritage of Cebu Monument. Mactan Island is a metropolis that has retained a rustic charm which boasts of a diverse collection of tourist spots and attractions. Get to know its rich history with a visit to the Magellan's Shrine and Monument of Lapu-Lapu, a bronze statue erected in remembrance of the first Philippine hero who defeated Spanish soldiers in 1521. Take a tour of the Alegre Guitar Factory and see why Cebu is world famous for its fine handcrafted guitars made by exceptional craftsmen.

title: Puerto Princesa: Trek to Batak Tribe Village
description: It started with a 1.5hr drive from Puerto Princesa to Tanabag, then a 1.5hr trek through the jungle. The walk was tranquil with the sound of nature, loved the river crossings. Upon reaching the village, we were greeted with smiles. It was really good to see their homes. Vegetables are grown, and protein is hunted. It was definitely an eye opener and such an awesome experience! Shout out to Ron: travel operator from Corazon Travel, his customer service is amazing!Roman: the local tour guide. So knowledgeable and accommodating. Gabs: the legend who guided us through the trek!Josh: the driver who played cool tunes! Highly recommend if you ever visit Palawan!!!

title: Private Underground River Day Tour with Lunch from El Nido
description: So well organised. About 15 of us on our tour leaving Puerto Princesa to the town of Sabang with a stop at lookout on the way and got a waterproof cover for my mobile phone at the stall there. Then a short boat ride from Sabang to the National Park. So beautiful on the water and at the Park. 6 to a boat with a guide and audio guide (a few languages as option) as we entered the Underground River / Cave. Saw swallows and bats, many cave formations. Definitely a must go trip if you are in the area. Buffet lunch back at Sabang, then 2 people went on a 1 hour tour of mangroves while the rest of the tour hung out at the nearby beach. All finished by 2pm and head back to PP.Warning - you are very likely to get wet either getting to the Park or leaving the Park to hop onto boat so bring a water proof bag or protect your mobile.

title: Boracay Helmet Diving
description: We'll pick you where you are staying in Boracay (8 pickup slots are available) and you will be red to where you gonna take this interesting underwater experience. The underwater Helmet Diving experience (Hydrodome breathing observation bubble) is a perfect choice to explore the underwater beauty in a comfortable way. This fun water activity has specially designed in such a way so that visitors who have no experience in diving. The helmet is tethered to a harness and is continuously filled with oxygen from a board tank when in water. Users need to wear a breathing apparatus or a wet suit while on this ride. Before going underwater, you will be given a 5-minute brief training on how to enjoy the experience. So it's all under the care of PADI certified experts. After the briefing, you will have this wonderful experience of encountering the precious marine life creatures.

title: Moalboal Sardines Run Private Tour
description:
Visiting the breathtaking Sardine Run off Moalboal's shore of Cebu Island is a must-see for tourists. Many sardines gather around Panagsama Beach, just in front of Savedra Dive Centre, inviting you to witness their incredible schooling behavior and how they react to your presence--all occurring only 30 meters away from the coast! For those not completely confident with swimming, make sure to use a life jacket!

Our private tour includes insurance, so that you can feel safe while exploring this unique underwater phenomenon. Our experienced guide will take care of you and will make sure you get to enjoy this incredible natural spectacle.

You?ÅEEEEEEEE???ÅEEEEEEEEll also be provided with snorkeling masks and fins so you get to enjoy an up-close encounter with the sardines.

We highly recommend our Moalboal Sardines Run Private Tour for anyone seeking a unique experience in Cebu.

title: Dumaguete Dolphin Watching & Manjuyod Sandbar
description:
An hour's drive north of Dumaguete brings you to Bais CIty, where an outrigger motorboat will cruise you along Tanon Strait to spot dolphins, and if lucky, whales too! You will also isit the Campuyo White Sandbar where you can swim and snorkel in its clear blue waters, or just laze around the fine white sand beach.

Cap off the morning with a hearty lunch onboard of mixed grill.

Headback to wharf by noontime and proceed to Sibulan.

TUcked 850M above sea level, northwest of Dumaguete, the twin lakes of Balinsasayao offer scenic views and excellent nature hikes. SPend the afternoon kayaking or padding on a local banca or trek your way through a 30 minutes rock trail around the Lake. Bring a windbreaker or jacket as the weather can be completely different, always, some shower.

For a unique, adventurous experience, you can Stand-up-Paddle on the lake, where the water is generally flat. We have SUP (STAND UP PADDLEBOARD) rentals. (SUP Board P800 per board + transportation P2000).

description:
Discover the rich history and heritage of Leyte. 
 
 This tour will take you through World War II History, ST Haiyan Stories and introduce to you the culture of the people called "Waraynons". 
 
 Meet the people and hear their stories of their struggle after Super Typhoon Haiyan and how they recovered from the tragedy. 
 
 So many inspiring stories.

title: Coron Shipwrecks and Lusong Coral Garden tour (Private / Shared)
description:
During this experience, you'll witness the famous World War II wreck that sits at the shallow ocean floor. Other than that we will visit Lusong Coral Garden to getup close with an array of dazzling marine life, excellent corals, vibrant colorful fishes and occasional sea turtles.
 
 We will visit the Lusong Gunboat : a famous snorkeling and diving site, a shallow area with a shipwreck that lays on an angle on its side. The gunboat is approximately 25m in length, and its stern can be visible at low tide.
 
 The East Tangat, sunk on the 24th of September 1944 during the World War II that was believed to be either a tugboat or an anti-submarine craft. This area has a good visibility and a very good shallow water, which makes it an ideal choice for snorkelers.
 Lusong Coral garden is a popular Coron Snorkeling experience featuring many varieties of corals. You will enjoy a good visibility there.
 
 We will visit the Pass island for a amazing snorkeling and island hopping experience.

title: Siargao 3 Island hopping + Corregidor Island
description: You will experience the crystal clear water surrounding the 3 islands. You will head first to Guyam Island or Naked Island and always the middle of the Day Trips will be at Daku Island. This is the Island where you are going to have lunch. Since it is a private Day Trips, you own your time and phase. You will have the boat from 8 am to 4:30 pm, and you need to be back at the General Luna docking port by 5 pm. Never leave Siargao not doing the island hopping. Visit Daku, Guyam, and Naked Island for a real taste of Siargao's beauty. Lastly, it is time to visit Corregidor Island, in which you will have an option to do hiking on top of Corregidor Island and feel and experience the little Batanes of Siargao. Corregidor Island offers also a white sand beach, crystal clear water, and a snorkeling activity which is optional for they are known for their fish sanctuary.

title: Whale Shark Watching with Canyoneering & Kawasan Falls + Sumilon Sandbar
description:
Oslob is in Cebu Island. Oslob is one of the two destinations in Philippines famous for Whale Shark watching. It is a Day Tripsist magnet and over a hundred thousand Day Tripsists come here every year to swim with the whale sharks.
 
 Sumilon Island is one of the gems of Oslob. Just a short boat ride from Oslob, the town famous for its local Whale Sharks, is a beautiful yet small island with crystal clear water and just one resort. Some might just call it paradise.
 
 Canyoneering or canyoneering (in US) is a popular outdoor trek that involves traveling down creeks or streams within a canyon through variety of means including walking, jumping, swimming, climbing, abseiling. Canyoneering will start at Canlaob river downstream going to Kawasan falls.
 
 Kawasan Falls is a beautiful spot on Cebu Island, where you can swim in clear turquoise water surrounded by lush green forests with the noise of powerful waterfalls rushing in the background.

title: Tabon Cave Day Trips From Puerto Princesa
description: Travel back in time with an exploration of the Tabon Caves in Puerto Princesa, a site known for its great historical value! Dubbed as the "Cradle of Civilization," the caves contains a large number of archaeological finds, including a skull cap that dates back thousands of years ago, as well as the Manunggul Jar, a burial jar listed as a national treasure. The Day Trips starts with a pick up at your hotel, followed by a scenic drive outside of mainland Palawan and a boat ride through tranquil waters. Enjoy a delicious lunch once you get to the island, which will refresh and reenergize you for the Day Trips of the caves! You'll then learn about the cave's historical significance as you explore the mysterious caves with your Day Trips guide, where you'll see impressive limestone formations as well as burial sites, right before you start your trip back to your hotel in Puerto Princesa.

title: Kawasan Waterfalls Journeys
description:
A trekking & swimming Day Trips to Kawasan waterfalls. The best activity to do in Cebu. Nature & local food experience is the best.
 KAWASAN FALLS in Badian, Cebu is ranked the sixth (6th) Most Beautiful Waterfall in the world according to London-based Australian travel vlogger Amanda O'Brien.
 "Kawasan Falls is surrounded by lush jungle scenery and steep limestone canyon walls. While soaking in the views, take a refreshing dip in the turquoise waters or enjoy a thrilling cliff diving experience," O'Brien said.

title: Whaleshark Experience & Kawasan Falls Canyooneering with Lunch
description:
Depart early at 4:30 AM & make the 4-hour drive from Cebu to Oslob. Arrive at Tan-awan, & pick up your snorkeling equipment so you can swim w/ the whalesharks. Sit down for a brief introduction before you go into the water.
 
 After your Whaleshark watching, take the adventure In Kawasan Falls Canyooneering knowing that you're in good hands w/ our experienced, safety conscious & highly skilled Day Trips guides whom you can confidently put your trust in. Shallow & deep at different stages but full of various rock formations under. Once you get to the top though, the view is breathtaking for it's clear, turquoise, cool water awaits inside this beautiful canyon full of stalagmites. Take your time walking through & watch your footing so you won't roll your ankle. Our guides are experts at knowing which side to walk. W/out a doubt scrambling is one of the most exhilarating part in Canyoneering. Most of our guest loves scrambling in the hidden canyons while our guides take some candid photos of them.

description: Located in Sitio Balanan, Siaton- about an hour and half drive from Dumaguete, Lake Balanan is 285 meters above sea level and is fed by the Lamarao, Balanan and Managobsob creeks. For those who love nature-trekking, there is a four-kilometer circumferential pathway around the Lake under a canopy of vaious indigenous forest trees. Trekkers will also get a chance to see three waterfalls at the other side of the Lake.

title: Private Whale Shark, Island hopping and Waterfall with Transport
description:
We offer an incredible day-long adventure through the stunning Cebu Island, starting bright and early at 3 am, where we will take you on a scenic drive across Cebu to Oslob. Here, we set off on a rowboat to get up close and personal with these majestic creatures. You will even have the opportunity to swim alongside them!
 
 Next, we'll take you on a fantastic island hopping adventure to Sumilon Island, where you can indulge in some snorkeling and bask in the sun on the beautiful white sand beach. After returning from the island, we'll stop for a delicious lunch before heading to Tumalog Falls, where you can immerse yourself in the refreshing, cool waters of the mountain springs.
 
 We will return you to your hotel or Airbnb by around 7 pm, ensuring that you have had an unforgettable experience on Cebu Island. Our goal is to provide you with a perfect mix of adventure and relaxation, creating memories that will last a lifetime.

description:

title: Oslob Whale Shark Snorkeling and Badian Canyoneeringg Adventure
description:
Learn more about this activity's Enhanced Health & Hygiene MeasuresHead to Oslob for a once in a lifetime chance to get up close to real whale sharksTick off a bucketlist experience: swim and snorkel with whale sharks in the PhilippinesParticipate in shark feeding and explore surrounding coral reefsScramble, climb, jump, rappel and swim through the rugged but scenic cliffs of BadianMake a splash as you brave through jumping off towering cliffs as high as 30 feet! 
    See moreThis is a truly once-in-a-lifetime experience: a swim with the whale sharks of Oslob, and going Canyoneeringg in the cliffs of Badian, all in one package! Your day starts very early as you are picked up in your hotel for breakfast in Oslob, and then it's right into the water to go whale shark watching and snorkeling with these gentle giants. You'll leave Oslob and the whale sharks for something a little more fast-paced: you'll arrive at Badian for a much-needed lunch before your Canyoneeringg adventure. You'll travel to the jump-off point and swim, climb, rappel and more all over Badian's picturesque cliffs, jumping off cliffs as high as thirty feet! And then you'll visit the beautiful blue waters of Kawasan Falls, where you can take a relaxing swim in the beautiful waters. You'll be brought back to your hotel carrying priceless memories and the thrill of adventure in your heart.

title: Boracay Tour Package (Island Hopping)
description:
Book this island tour package and discover Boracay's white-sandy beaches, pristine waters, and fun attractions!Embark on an island-hopping adventure around the likes of Puka Beach, Diniwid Beach, and Crocodile IslandTake the opportunity to relax on the beach or snorkel around to discover and admire the colorful aquatic faunaIncluded in the tour package is a delicious grilled buffet lunch that you can relish with your family and friendsLooking to enjoy the view of Boracay from above? Then book a Parasailing activity for an aerial adventure 
    See moreBoracay is one of the Philippines' prime summer and beach getaway destinations. There, you'll find numerous beaches, many of them unsoiled, along with colorful sea creatures beneath crystal clear waters. Book this island tour package to embark on an exhilarating island-hopping adventure that will take you to several of the island's popular and can't-miss tourist sites, from Crocodile Island to the likes of Puka Beach. A special boat will be reserved for this activity, As you cruise around, you'll be able to bask in the tranquility of the ocean, feel the sea breeze, and marvel at the breathtaking scenery. There will be several stops at various scenic spots on the way and you'll be allotted time to take a dip into the ocean or go snorkeling to your heart's content. It also includes a visit to Magic Island, where you can experience cliff diving at the famous Crystal Cove, where local artifacts are displayed for public viewing. If you select the package that comes with helmet diving, you can cap off your escapade by getting up close and personal with the island's majestic marine life! Whichever Boracay package you select, you're in for an exciting and comprehensive exploration of the island's natural treasures.

title: El Nido Tour A
description:
Discover the clear waters of Miniloc Island, where you can explore three breathtaking lagoonsSoak up the sun and relax on the white sand beaches of Shimizu island and explore the majestic Big Lagoon in the Big Lagoon TourOr escape to Secret Beach beach and kayak through the peaceful, crystal waters of Small Lagoon in the Small Lagoon Tour 
    See moreOne of the most famous destinations in the Philippines are the famed El Nido Islands. This beach paradise is so famous that no trip to the Philippines would be complete without a visit! This package will take you straight to its most beautiful lagoons full of picture perfect wonder. The big lagoon features the full beauty of El Nido's lagoons: rippling clear waters, rock formations around you and under the water, like an idyllic marine waterway. The Secret Lagoon is straight out of a storybook, where you duck into a small entrance to reveal a secluded pool of crystal water surrounded by rocks, bringing back memories of stories of mermaids and fairytales. After lunch, you'll head to Shimizu Island's white beaches and get to experience its untouched natural beauty nestled in the waters. You'll the learn of the name origins of 7 Commando Beach, your next stop, where you'll be able to relax and take a dip in the clear blue ocean. There's no doubt that this tour of El Nido will take you to a world of aquatic wonder, one you will not soon forget.

description:
